title: 113_hr4925
content: The Act may be cited as the "TIFIA 2.0 Act" and pertains to TIFIA funding. The Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to receive amounts for funding, including repayments, unobligated budget authority, and proceeds from secured loans. The Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act Revolving Fund receives proceeds from secured loans, interest on investments, and fees established by the Secretary of Transportation. Disbursements from the Fund are made by the Secretary for carrying out the chapter. Additionally, a rural set-aside of up to 10% of the deposited amounts is designated for rural infrastructure projects in the following fiscal year. The Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act Revolving Fund receives proceeds from secured loans, interest on investments, and fees established by the Secretary of Transportation. Disbursements from the Fund are made for carrying out the chapter. Any unobligated amounts by June 1 of a fiscal year are reinvested. The Secretary transfers equivalent amounts to the Treasury from repayments on direct loans made before the TIFIA 2.0 Act. The Secretary of the Treasury invests excess funds in interest-bearing obligations of the United States. The Secretary of the Treasury credits interest earned on obligations to the Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act Revolving Fund. The Secretary may use up to 0.50 percent of the Fund for administrative costs. A term sheet executed by the Secretary for a Federal credit instrument creates a contractual obligation for the United States to fund the investment. The United States has a contractual obligation to fund the Federal credit investment without fiscal year limitation or further appropriation. Amendments are made to Chapter 6 of the title regarding subsidy costs associated with the investment. Amendments are made to Chapter 6 of the title regarding subsidy costs associated with the investment, including waiving requirements for public agency borrowers with outstanding senior bonds under a preexisting indenture if certain conditions are met. Amendments to Chapter 6 of the title involve waiving requirements for public agency borrowers with outstanding senior bonds under a preexisting indenture if specific conditions are met, such as having a line of credit rated in the A category or higher. The TIFIA program loan is payable from pledged revenues unaffected by project performance, with a 33 percent or less share of eligible project costs. SEC. 3. DETERMINATION OF ELIGIBILITY AND PROJECT SELECTION. Amendment to Section 602 of title 23, United States Code to include generating revenue through tolls or user fees for eligible projects. Priority in selecting projects for funding under the application process. Priority consideration for funding projects under this chapter will be given to sponsors with a history of fully repaid credit agreements.
